title: Tour de France 2021 Standings after Stage 7
content:
General Classification / Yellow Jersey

The yellow jersey of Mathieu van der Poel (Alpecin-Fenix) and Wout van Aert (Jumbo-Visma) were both in the breakaway in stage 7, meaning Van der Poel extended his lead on the GC by several minutes over Tadej Pogačar (UAE Team Emirates). Van Aert moves up to second.

His teammate Primož Roglič (Jumbo-Visma) was dropped from the peloton, and has fallen out of overall contention. 

1. Mathieu van der Poel
2. Wout van Aert +0:30
3. Kasper Asgreen +1:49
4. Matej Mohorič +3:01
5. Tadej Pogačar +3:43
6. Vincenzo Nibali +4:12
7. Julian Alaphilippe +4:23
8. Alexey Lutsenko +4:56
9. Pierre Latour +5:03
10. Rigoberto Uran +5:18

Tour de France 2021 Guide

Points Classification / Green Jersey

Once again proving the impressive form he's carrying in to the Tour, Cavendish snuck in to the day's breakaway and picked up maximum points in the only sprint point of the day, extending his lead in the Green jersey competition.

1. Mark Cavendish - 168 points
2. Mathieu van der Poel - 103 points
3. Jasper Philipsen - 102 points
4. Nacer Bouhanni - 99 points
5. Michael Matthews - 96 points

King of the Mountains Classification / Polka-Dot Jersey

Today's eventual stage winner Matej Mohorič wears the mountains jersey in to tomorrow's stage after a strong showing in the hills.

1. Matej Mohorič - 11 points
2. Ide Schelling - 5 points
3. Mathieu van der Poel - 4 points
4. Jasper Stuyven - 4 points
5. Anthony Perez - 3 points

Young Rider's Classification / White Jersey

Despite falling some places in the general classification, Tadej Pogačar retains his lead in the young rider's classification. After UAE Team Emirates made some tactical errors today, Pogačar will likely try and win back some time on his rivals in tomorrow's mountain stage.

1. Tadej Pogačar
2. Jonas Vingegaard +1:35
3. David Gaudu +2:27
4. Sergio Higuita +2:58
5. Aurélien Paret-Peintre +5:14

Team Classification

1. Team Jumbo-Visma
2. Trek-Segafredo +0:13
3. EF Education Nippo +2:25
4.Bahrain Victorious +3:07
5. Astana - Premier Tech +4:40

Cover image: A.S.O./Alex Broadway
author: Peter Stuart
